FuncDef:
The forward-mode loopback command sets the packet forwarding mode to loopback on a VBDIF interface.
The undo forward-mode command restores the default configuration.
By default, the packet forwarding mode is not set to loopback on a VBDIF interface.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, when a Layer 3 network connects to a PW network through VBDIF interfaces, the following problems exist:
MTU fragmentation is not supported when the PW encapsulation process is used in the downstream direction.Downstream multicast traffic statistics for a VBDIF interface are statistics on traffic replicated for VBDIF interface's member interfaces.
After the forward-mode loopback command is run to set the packet forwarding mode to loopback, downstream MTU fragmentation is supported on a VBDIF interface and multicast traffic statistics are for a copy of traffic forwarded from the VBDIF interfaces.

Precautions
After the forwarding mode is set to loopback on a VBDIF interface, the interface's forwarding performance deteriorates. Set the forwarding mode as required.
The configuration fails if the following situations are met:
A BD is bound to a VSI.The igmp-snooping enable command is run in the BD view.The mpls vpls convergence separate enable command is run in the system view or VSI view.
